abstract_summ: In contrast, macropinocytosis inhibitors attenuated CHIKV-pseudotyped MLV vector infection in TE671 cells but not in 293T cells, suggesting that CHIKV host cell entry occurs via endocytosis or macropinocytosis, depending on the cell lines used.Mesenchymal stem cells can suppress nonproductive inflammation and improve/repair lung cells including endothelial and alveolar cells, which damaged by COVID-19 virus infection.We first characterized the kinetics of PEDV entry into cells and found that the highest invasion rate of PEDV was approximately 33% in the IPEC-J2 cells and approximately 100% in the Vero cells.This review recapitulates our current knowledge on how caveolae/caveolin-1 functions in every step of the viral infection cycle and various relevant signaling pathways, hoping to provide a new perspective for future viral cell biology research.Upon cell entry, viruses gain access to all the macromolecular machinery necessary to replicate, assemble, and bud their progeny from the infected cell.
title_summ: Scalable Analysis of Authentic Viral Envelopes on FRONTERAInterferon-Induced Transmembrane Protein 3 Blocks Fusion of Diverse Enveloped Viruses by Locally Altering Mechanical Properties of Cell MembranesHSV Forms an HCMV-like Viral Assembly Center in Neuronal CellsImplications for tetraspanin-enriched microdomain assembly based on structures of CD9 with EWI-FHighly efficient intercellular spreading of protein misfolding mediated by viral ligand - receptor interactionsAirway Exosomes Released During Influenza Virus Infection Serve as a Key Component of the Antiviral Innate Immune ResponseTetraspanin CD81 regulates HSV-1 infectionInvolvement of lipid microdomains in human endothelial cells infected by Streptococcus agalactiae type III belonging to the hypervirulent ST-17Dynamics of transmissible gastroenteritis virus internalization unraveled by single‐virus tracking in live cellsTetraspanin CD9 affects HPV16 infection by modulating ADAM17 activity and the ERK signalling pathwayHPV caught in the tetraspanin web?Single virus tracking of Ebola virus entry through lipid rafts in living host cellsOrchestrated efforts on host network hijacking: Processes governing virus replicationMultifaceted Functions of Host Cell Caveolae/Caveolin-1 in Virus InfectionsThe role of extracellular vesicles in COVID-19 virus infectionAntibody-induced internalisation of retroviral envelope glycoproteins is a signal initiation eventPEDV enters cells through clathrin-, caveolae-, and lipid raft-mediated endocytosis and traffics via the endo-/lysosome pathwayBaculovirus transit through insect cell membranes: A mechanistic approachThe Role of Extracellular Vesicles as Allies of HIV, HCV and SARS VirusesAcid ceramidase of macrophages traps herpes simplex virus in multivesicular bodies and protects from severe diseaseTwo‐pore channels regulate Tat endolysosome escape and Tat‐mediated HIV‐1 LTR transactivationHerpes simplex virus 1 regulates β-catenin expression in TG neurons during the latency-reactivation cycleExosome mimicry by a HAVCR1-NPC1 pathway of endosomal fusion mediates hepatitis A virus infection.Cathepsin B Protease Facilitates Chikungunya Virus Envelope Protein-Mediated Infection via Endocytosis or Macropinocytosis.Platelets Endocytose Viral Particles and Are Activated via TLR (Toll-Like Receptor) Signaling.
title_abstract_phrases: In contrast, macropinocytosis inhibitors attenuated CHIKV-pseudotyped MLV vector infection in TE671 cells but not in 293T cells, suggesting that CHIKV host cell entry occurs via endocytosis or macropinocytosis, depending on the cell lines used.Upon cell entry, viruses gain access to all the macromolecular machinery necessary to replicate, assemble, and bud their progeny from the infected cell.On viral infection, “autophagy” and “programmed cell death” are two dynamically synchronized cell survival programs; “immune response” is a cell defense program typically suppressed by viruses; “cell cycle alteration” and “lipid metabolic reprogramming” are two altered cell housekeeping programs tunable in both directions.As well, exosomes contain receptors for viruses that make recipient cells susceptible to virus entry.We first characterized the kinetics of PEDV entry into cells and found that the highest invasion rate of PEDV was approximately 33% in the IPEC-J2 cells and approximately 100% in the Vero cells.
